text: Gray around 1911–1914 Percival Gray (born ) was an English sailor. During his early career he served on the Worcester and the Archibald Russell, and then joined the New Zealand Shipping Company. From 1909 to 1911, he worked for the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company. During this time he attained his First Officer's certificate. From 1911 to 1914, during the Australasian Antarctic expedition, he served as second and navigating officer aboard the , under John King Davis, for all five cruises. Cape Gray, in King George V Land in Antarctica, was named after him by Douglas Mawson. == References == Category:Australasian Antarctic Expedition Category:Date of birth unknown Category:Date of death unknown
title: Percival Gray
